That observer also triggers the dispenser?
so it triggers the repeater first (and the dispenser does nothing because there's a hsulker infront of it)
that powers the right piston with a 1 tick pulse
that powers the repeater on the top
and since the piston was powered for more than 1 tick
when it arrives at the top
and it also bud powers the dropper ejecting a new shulker box
yeah it's a very nice design

Seems like the hoppers could be not on opposite sides and you could snake the water stream around over all the hoppers.

... once one shulkerbox is full the last hopper fills up to 23 and locks the hopper above ... everything activates and a new empty one is placed ... one item flows in and one gets refilled in the hopper ... back to 23 items and the thing activates at a enearly empty box
so if the bottom hopper ever fills too much you're in trouble
cuz it has to fill up in the first place
Are yo talking about if one of those hoppers was pointing down?
I thought about this but I decided the 4 tick delay on the top repeaters helped
the problem is that you'll also detect when the hopper is unlocked
and that'll happen immediately after you place your shulker

The server I started a couple years back kept going even after I had to leave the game for a while.  Still a fairly tight knit group
Been trying to come up with a quick way to clear a furnace array system lately.  Not sure what other people have nowadays
if you never merge two lines of hoppers into one
but items on ice are still faster anwyay
yeah I did that with one of my arrays I've worked on:
the system can clear a double chest in a little over four minutes
Have you seen these fast unloaders that use two hopper minecarts under a double chest
each of the 4 hoppers distributes to its own array
shouldn't that clear a double chest in a about 1.5 minutes?
That clears the double chest of the initial input that quickly.  But those same smelted items do not clear the entirety of the system that quickly
I'm talking 4 mins and 30 seconds for a complete smelting of a double chest
thats what you mean by the hopper draining the input?
two hopper carts into 8 hoppers for the input chest
using the glass panes there is pretty tidy 😃
yeah its pretty quick.  but it gets held up by filling up the hoppers faster then they can distribute
Furnace arrays? Build a bigger one or make that fuel efficent xD
oh maybe once the furnaces are full it stops
I'm not even a friend and I'm green

I was using Cyan's furnace array design.  Can't say I'm a huge fan of it in practical application.  seems the locking/unlocking of the hoppers isn't always bang on.  And it skips the 7th hopper in the line as well.
Well you are a special little thing
well in the case of the furnace array
The hopper unlocking design has been around for awhile
what problem is locking/unlocking the hoppers trying to fix?
I will propably try to make a furnace array at some point
I think i know how to make a quarry a) 10 times faster than normal quarry or b) even faster by preventing the going back and forth
Locking/unlocking them simply ensures even distribution of materiels to be smelted.
Couch told me he had a good idea for a large furnace array
Well you can go the cart route
you'll fill up the first furnace till it's full
Didn't look too closely at Minnerva's recent endeavour
I've been trying something like this for fater draining.
you're still limited by the hopper speed
which is faster than the furnace smelts
How so?  In terms of a large array
I mean if you smelt many more items than you have furnaces
the time from the furnace to the output is some constant number of seconds
this seems like a good approach though
Exactly.  There are some very efficient and resource friendly 64 furnace designs that use a minecart.  But the furthest furnace's item needs to travel 64+ hoppers to get to the output box
I guess there's basically the same problem when loading the furnaces if you use hoppers
To get to the furthest furnace you have to go through many hoppers
yep.  The only solution is more bandwidth.  Ie more hopper lines distributing input
(i guess it doesn't get absorbed into the smelting time)
you could do something with water streams and hoppers that only accept one item every 64 ticks or so
Well one of the problems im encountering with making the output items into entities and moving over ice/water is the occassional group of items getting stuck in glass.
I'd imagine similar parasitic loss could occur by doing the same with input items
yeah -so they get stuck actually in the glass blocks? They should at least pop out on the top
not sure if its a client-side visual artifact
so the stone on top of the ice in the left column is just shaking back and forth
and I could pick it up when I went over top of it.   A stack of 64.
That's weird - i've never seen that before
someone else might know more about it 😃
i think ive seen that before
i use a cobble wall behind a solid block
squishing a stack of items would allow for the movement of a stack of items instead of individual items via a dropper.
the piston retracts/extends and 'squishes' items into the fence column.
as items pass over they trigger the block retraction
the trapdoor is placed against a block that was broken and would be the trailing end of water
why do you use the fence?
and its cause it has zero gap when surrounded by solid blocks
its based off of several other item elevators
this is more reliable than squishing the blocks up with the piston?
ive tested it for over half a year
because the items just instantaneously go from outside the block to inside
rather than also gettin gmoved up by the block as the piston extends?
put a chest on top of the cobble wall

if i added that little thingy before the upwards piston in the guardian storage
